protocol

Class LinkableProtocol

  • java.lang.Object
    • protocol.LinkableProtocol
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, peersim.core.Cleanable, peersim.core.Linkable, peersim.core.Protocol

    public class LinkableProtocol
extends java.lang.Object
implements peersim.core.Linkable, peersim.core.Protocol
    Implements the Linkable protocol that manages the FPeer's neighborhood view.
    Since:
    March 9, 2015
    Author:
    Giuseppe Miraglia

      • addNeighbor

        public boolean addNeighbor(peersim.core.Node peer)
        Tries to add the passed FPeer peer to the neighborhood of the running FPeer.
        Specified by:
        addNeighbor in interface peersim.core.Linkable
        Parameters:
        peer - the FPeer to add to the neighborhood of the running FPeer
        Returns:
        false if peer is already a neighbor of the running FPeer or if the insertion fails. true otherwise.

      • removeNeighbor

        public boolean removeNeighbor(FPeer fpeer)
        Removes the passed FPeer fpeer from the neighborhood of the running FPeer.
        Parameters:
        fpeer - the FPeer to remove from the neighborhood of the running FPeer
        Returns:
        true if fpeer is in the running FPeer's neighborhood and it is removed successfully; false otherwise.

        Returns:

        Throws:

      • getNeighborByLocationKey

        public FPeer getNeighborByLocationKey(double locKey)
        Returns the FPeer, neighbor of the running FPeer, having location key equal to the passed location key locKey.
        Parameters:
        locKey - the location key based on which retrieve the neighbor FPeer
        Returns:
        the FPeer that have locKey as location key

      • getNeighborsIterator

        public java.util.Iterator<FPeer> getNeighborsIterator()
        Gets out the iterator to iterate on the entire list of neighbors of the running FPeer.
        Returns:
        the iterator to iterate on the entire list of neighbors of the running FPeer.

      • retrieveTopKNeighbors

        public java.util.ArrayList<FPeer> retrieveTopKNeighbors(double locationKey,
                                               int k)
        Computes the k neighbors FPeers of the running FPeer that are closest w.r.t. the passed location key locationKey. "Closest" means similar on location key values, so less is the circul distance between the value of two location keys, more similar are the two location keys.
        Parameters:
        locationKey - the location key on which perform the similarity check
        k - the maximum number of most similar FPeers that the method should returns
        Returns:
        topK the list of the k most similar FPeer w.r.t the passed locationKey, in decreasing order of similarity.

      • updateNeighborhood

        public boolean updateNeighborhood(FPeer fpeer_update,
                         FPeer fpeer_toAvoid,
                         int linkablePID,
                         boolean remove)
        Performs the update (adding or removing) of the neighborhood tree-representation of each one of the neighbors of the running FPeer with the passed FPeer fpeer_update, avoiding the passed FPeer fpeer_toAvoid.
        Parameters:
        fpeer_update - the FPeer with which update the trees
        fpeer_toAvoid - the FPeer to avoid during the trees update
        linkablePID - the protocol identifier of the Linkable protocol used during the simulation
        remove - flag that specify if the update perform removes or adds
        Returns:
        true if all the add/remove operations was completed successfully. false otherwise.
